title: I Was a Communist for the F.B.I.

sources.title: I Was A Communist For The FBI (1951) Frank Lovejoy, Dorothy Hart
sources.description: I Was a Communist for the FBI is a 1951 American FILM NOlR  crime film directed by Gordon Douglas and starring Frank Lovejoy and Dorothy Hart.    The film was based on a series of stories written by Matt Cvetic, who infiltrated a local Communist Party cell for nine years and reported back to the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) on their activities.   The purpose of the movie is partly to warn people about the threat of Communist subversion of American society. The tone  is ultra-patriotic, with Communists portrayed as racist, vindictive, and tools of a totalitarian foreign power, the Soviet Union.   You can find out more about this movie from Wikipedia and read an article from FILM NOlR of the Week .

metadata.Plot: The FBI infiltrates one of their agents, Matt Cvetic, into the US Communist Party. This causes big problems in the normal life of the agent. Nobody knows, including his family, that he is in fact working to expose a large-scale plan to have Communists in key positions in industry and unions.
metadata.Writer: Crane Wilbur, Matt Cvetic, Pete Martin
metadata.Actors: Frank Lovejoy, Dorothy Hart, Philip Carey
